headline: Stocks Slip as Gold, Silver Hit New Records
summary: STOCKS  Disappointing earnings from Microsoft fed into a tech selloff Thursday, pushing the Nasdaq composite down more than 1%. Investors recoiled after Microsoft reported higher-than-expected spending on AI infrastructure and slower cloud growth, putting its stock on course for the worst pullback since early 2020.

headline: Stock Market Today: Nasdaq Down As Sellers Sting Microsoft, ServiceNow; Meta Up, BKV Breaks Out (Live Coverage)
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and other major stock indexes reversed from earlier gains and fell sharply Thursday, as Wall Street digested a slew of big earnings results.  Meta Platforms soared, while Tesla dropped on the stock market today, and Microsoft plunged on its results.  After the market closes, all eyes are expected to shift to earnings from Apple.

headline: Wall Street Sours on Software
summary: The rout underscores how fast Wall Street’s enthusiasm for the sector has evaporated in the months since the emergence of “vibe coding”—the practice of using AI tools to quickly produce apps and websites.  ServiceNow, which reported earnings Wednesday afternoon, is down 11%.  ServiceNow's recent streak of acquisitions have caused some concerns over whether the company's organic growth is slowing.

raw.headline: Wall Street Sours on Software

headline: Wall Street Souring on Software
summary: ServiceNow, which reported earnings Wednesday afternoon, is down 11%.  The drop comes amid ServiceNow's recent streak of acquisitions, which have caused some concerns over whether the company's organic growth is slowing.  Cloud-software provider Salesforce was recently down about 8%—on pace for the largest percent decrease in nearly two years, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: SAP Dives Amid Mixed Results As Key Cloud Metric Disappoints
summary: SAP stock plunged after the business software maker reported fourth quarter profit that topped estimates while revenue slightly missed.  A key cloud-computing-related metric for SAP stock came in below expectations.  "Current Cloud Backlog growth of 25% in constant currency was below target of 26%, driving shares lower," said TD Cowen analyst Derrick Wood in a report.

headline: US software stocks slide after SAP, ServiceNow results fuel AI disruption fears
summary: U.S. software stocks fell on Thursday after SAP's cautious cloud outlook and a post-earnings drop in ServiceNow ​shares reinforced investor concerns about mounting competition from artificial intelligence-related ‌companies.  ServiceNow dropped 9.6% despite forecasting annual subscription revenue above Wall Street estimates.  The double-whammy dragged Salesforce shares down 5.6%, while Photoshop maker Adobe and ‍cloud security firm Datadog fell 3.1% each.

ServiceNow dropped 9.6% despite forecasting annual subscription revenue above Wall Street estimates.  The double-whammy dragged Salesforce shares down 5.6%, while Photoshop maker Adobe and ‍cloud security firm Datadog fell 3.1% each.

headline: ServiceNow Earnings Beat Estimates. Why the Software Stock Is Tumbling.
summary: ServiceNow  can’t catch a break.  The software company’s earnings report beat expectations but investors are shunning the sector and still look wary of its acquisition strategy, sending shares lower early Thursday.  ServiceNow delivered better-than-expected quarterly results and an upbeat outlook in its earnings after the market close on Wednesday.

summary: Enterprise workflow automation company ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 20.7% year on year to $3.57 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.92 per share was 3.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Microsoft yanks Wall Street lower as gold's price suddenly snaps back
summary: The worst day for Microsoft in years is yanking the U.S. stock market away from its record heights on Thursday.  Microsoft was the heaviest weight on the market by far, and it tumbled 12% even though the tech giant reported stronger profit and revenue for the latest quarter than analysts expected.  Investors honed in instead on how much Microsoft is spending on investments, whether growth in its Azure cloud business will slow and how long its push into artificial-intelligence technology will take to turn into big profits.

raw.headline: Microsoft yanks Wall Street lower as gold's price suddenly snaps back
raw.summary: The worst day for Microsoft in years is yanking the U.S. stock market away from its record heights on Thursday.  Microsoft was the heaviest weight on the market by far, and it tumbled 12% even though the tech giant reported stronger profit and revenue for the latest quarter than analysts expected.  Investors honed in instead on how much Microsoft is spending on investments, whether growth in its Azure cloud business will slow and how long its push into artificial-intelligence technology will take to turn into big profits.
